meta.title: Dushyanth Nagesh Gowda | Software Engineer
meta.description: Software Engineer specializing in high-performance mobile, frontend, and scalable systems. Experience across Tesla, PlayStation, Version1, and Cerner.

identity.name: Dushyanth Nagesh Gowda
identity.headline: Software Engineer | Mobile, Frontend, Performance, Scalable Systems
identity.tagline: I build fast, reliable, user-centric products across mobile, web, and backend systems.

education.school: The University of Texas at Arlington

education.degree: BTech in Computer Science and Engineering

domains.label: Mobile Apps
domains.description: React Native apps with performance, offline-ready patterns, notifications, and native integrations.

domains.label: Web Platforms
domains.description: Product-grade web apps with robust UI architecture, state management, and accessibility.

domains.label: Desktop Systems
domains.description: Win32/MFC enhancements and stability improvements for enterprise desktop applications.

domains.label: Backend and BFF
domains.description: TypeScript/Node services, BFF patterns, and GraphQL APIs that simplify product integration.

domains.label: Microservices
domains.description: Java/TS services focused on reliability, observability, and performance.

domains.label: Real-time Systems
domains.description: SSE/WebSocket patterns for live updates and streaming experiences.

domains.label: AI-driven Features
domains.description: FastAPI services and ML inference pipelines for predictive insights.

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
experience.summary: Worked on Tesla Mobile App experiences for service and roadside, delivering product features across BFF and UI layers and improving reliability and observability.
highlights: Integrated Glass Selector for Model Y Refresh and Cybertruck flows.
Added Insurance Selector for glass repair experiences.
Built and extended a BFF architecture using TypeScript, Express, and GraphQL.
Used Splunk logs to debug, instrument, and improve production behavior.
Enhanced Tesla Assist by fixing bugs and improving user experience and reliability.

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
experience.summary: Worked on PS5 console social experience features used by millions of players worldwide.
highlights: Developed the Active Speaker Indicator for PS5 voice chat, released globally.
Migrated voice chat modules from JavaScript to TypeScript to improve reliability and maintainability.
Participated in SummerJam hackathon and built prototypes integrating OpenAI and related tools.

experience.title: React Developer (Foundations Team)
experience.summary: Built internal and customer-facing tools and shipped a major React Native migration as a sole developer under tight deadlines.
highlights: Built a cloud discovery / portfolio assessment tool using Angular, TypeScript, and SCSS.
Developed interactive data visualizations using D3 for insight-heavy workflows.
Implemented Server-Sent Events for live updates and streaming progress.
Automated cycle-time calculations and reporting using GitLab automation and cron jobs.
Migrated the Dublin Airport mobile app from Xamarin to React Native within one month as the sole developer.
Rehauled UI/UX, improved performance, added geofencing, push notifications, real-time updates, and chatbot integration.

experience.title: Software Engineer (Intern → SE I → SE II)
experience.summary: Worked on healthcare systems across desktop and web surfaces, optimizing performance and improving stability across critical workflows.
highlights: Started as an intern and contributed to refactoring initiatives.
Enhanced Win32 desktop application functionality using C++ and MFC.
Enhanced Java microservices supporting core order workflows.
Optimized CCL scripts to improve performance in key order processing scenarios.
Worked in the Orders team across PowerOrders and MPages modules (Orders, Home Medication, PDMP).
Built web UI components using React and Mithril.js.
Implemented unit testing using JUnit, Jest, and Karma.
Built automation using Selenium and internal testing tooling.
Received the Night of the Town award.

featured.title: MoneyMind
featured.oneLiner: AI-powered personal finance platform spanning mobile, backend APIs, and ML inference.
details: Mobile-first product experience with finance workflows.
Backend APIs designed for secure data handling and scalable operations.
AI service for predictive insights powered by an XGBoost model.

featured.title: ConferNet
featured.oneLiner: Role-based conference management platform with web UI and backend services.
details: Role-based experiences for organizers, speakers, and attendees.
Backend services for event and user workflows.

featured.title: Global Cursors

details: Backend connection management for live sessions.

recommendations.note: Add curated excerpts from LinkedIn recommendations. Keep each quote short (1–2 lines). Provide a link to the full recommendation.

rules: Keep animations under 300ms for most UI interactions

optional3D.notes: If enabled later, use a subtle hero background via React Three Fiber and ensure no performance regressions.
